itemDescription: British general, physician, educator, historian, writer, editor and Royal Physician

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir William Porter MacArthur,  (11 March 1884 – 30 July 1964) was an Irish British Army officer and doctor. He served as Commandant of the Royal Army Medical College from 1935 to 1938, and Director General Army Medical Services from 1938 to 1941. His specialism as a doctor was tropical medicine and he served as President of the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene from 1959 to 1961.
